category.name: Active Workspace
category.category_description: No description available for this category.

preference.name: AWS_FullTextSearch_Solr_URL
preference.preference_description: Contains the list of URLs to the Solr installation for the Active Workspace full text search functionality.

preference.name: Fms_BootStrap_Urls
preference.preference_description: Indicates the list of FSC Bootstrap servers. Starting with V10, FMS is being used by Multi-Site to transfer bulk data files between sites which are V10 or greater. During the local import phase when pulling data via a remote import, or during the import phase at this site when it is the target site to which data is being pushed from another site (via the data_sync utility for example), FMS servers will be used to transfer the bulk data files involved. Check with your site admin or FMS installer to get hostname(s) and port number(s) of the appropriate FSC "Bootstrap Servers" for this site. For example, if your nearest FSC server is running on a host named hostabc and listening on port 4447, the value for this preference can be defined as http://hostabc:4447.

preference.name: Default_Transient_Volume_Id
preference.preference_description: Defines the transient volume identifier of an FMS transient volume on the Corporate server. This site preference will be set by the installer.

preference.name: Transient_Volume_Installation_Location
preference.preference_description: The 4-tier transient Volume can be mounted on all Teamcenter Server hosts at a given location. In such mounted transient volume scenario, the distributed transient volume can be configured using this preference.

preference.name: Default_Transient_Server
preference.preference_description: FMS uses this preference to set the default transient file server for the site. This is a URL to an FSC, used for the 4-tier transient volumes. This should point to a valid address of a deployed FSC that has access to the transient volume. OS Environment variable settings override the preference.

preference.name: Transient_Volume_RootDir
preference.preference_description: This preference is defined as a multivalue preference, to support a Unix and Windows NT heterogeneous site. FMS will use the first value which is valid for the platform, Unix or NT, where the validity check is simply the presence or absence of a backslash \ character. This preference is used with both 2 tier and 4 tier. For 4 tier you have to additionally configure transient volume FSC process. Also for 4 tier the process owner for transient volume FSC process and tcserver should be the same owner.

category.name: Full Text Search
category.category_description: No description available for this category.

preference.name: TC_fts_host
preference.preference_description: Specifies the IP address of the host machine running the Autonomy Server.

preference.name: TC_fts_fsf_host
preference.preference_description: Specifies the IP address of the host machine running the Autonomy File System Fetch (FSF).

preference.name: TC_max_number_of_retries
preference.preference_description: Retry Control. If Teamcenter cannot lock an object, how may times should it try before reporting an error.

preference.name: TC_retry_time
preference.preference_description: Indicates the number of seconds to pause between each retry of locking an object.

preference.name: Mail_server_name
preference.preference_description: Information about the mail gateway server. This is a site preference. It can be set to either a mail server name or to a numeric IP address. The mail server name should be a machine running a send mail daemon. Leaving it as"your mail server machine" while the"Mail_OSMail_activated" preference is true may give you errors telling you to set this preference if you try to use the"Send" command.

preference.name: Mail_OS_from_address
preference.preference_description: Defines a "From" e-mail address for OS notification e-mails. Valid vallues are: * a valid email address: this value appears in the e-mail header "From" line. * an empty value: the "From" email address is taken from the sender's Person definition. This is the default value.

category.name: Product Structure.RDV
category.category_description: No description available for this category.

preference.name: EPM_tessellation_servers
preference.preference_description: Preference setting for Tessellation Server. This should be set to <hostname>:<portno> where hostname corresponds to the machine where the Tessellation Server runs and portno corresponds to the port where it listens to the requests. NONE represents the stand alone mode of Tessellation Server.

preference.name: WEB_default_site_server
preference.preference_description: Defines the URL of the default site server used for mail notifications (CR-Notify) and other server oriented tasks. The format is for instance "www.foo.com:8080".

preference.name: WEB_default_site_deployed_app_name
preference.preference_description: Defines the name of the deployed application. Application name is chosen at installation time; the default name is 'tc'. It appears in Thin Client URLs like this: http://server:port/<app_name>/webclient.
